children.text: There has not been a plaster control joint installed into the mid-floor area in the stairwell/void.
The Victorian Building Authority’s Guide to Standards and Tolerances states in section 9.11 Plasterboard Sheeting, that
‘The installation and jointing of plasterboard sheeting systems is defective if it does not conform to AS/NZS 2589 and the manufacturer’s installation instructions’ .
The wall sheet manufacturer’s installation manual states that

‘Plasterboard linings are not designed to withstand stresses due to structural movements or excessive changes in temperature or humidity. potential stress build up and cracking can be minimised by incorporating control joints’
‘Provide horizontal control joints at mid-floors in stairwells in multi-storey buildings’ .

The builder should either install a control joint or similar to this area, or provide the owners with a warranty specific to this issue to protect them from and potential future issues/cracking that may occur as a result of omitting the control joints.
